text: hello this is chef john from food wishes
comm with mystery noodles that's right a
mysterious new food form that we may or
may not have invented that quite frankly
I have no idea what this is so let me
explain and then I will ask you for some
help so I was going to make a semolina
pancake batter so I took an egg and some
milk and a little sugar and a little
salt at that point I was thinking you
know what don't make sembly two pancakes
make semolina crepes alright so I didn't
add any baking powder or anything like
that I just put in my semolina flour
until I had basically a batter so then I
thought to myself I will fry these thin
semolina pancakes and then maybe I will
caramelize them with some fruit jam to
make you know like a breakfast type item
and then as I was making the second one
I thought to myself hey semolina and egg
is the main ingredient in pasta what if
what if I took these cooked semolina
crepe pancake things rolled them up and
cut them into noodles what would happen
and then I was thinking that's pretty
cool that's kind of like a pasta look at
that so then I thought well now that I
have these strange semolina crepe pasta
noodle things I should take some hot
olive oil and some chili flakes and
maybe warm it up in the pan like it's
pasta noodles like they are pieces of
pasta so that's what I did and as I was
cooking it I was thinking you know what
this is a lot like spaetzle which is
kind of a fried dumpling noodle thing so
as I was daydreaming about all this
stuff my noodles ended up going from
lightly toasted to almost crispy so then
I thought to myself screw it I'm going
to grate some Parmesan cheese on this
which I did which kind of got a little
crispy on the hot noodle or whatever it
is then I put it on a plate and I was
just nothing short of completely
confused it wasn't like a pasta although
it kind of was
Casta it wasn't like a noodle it was
kind of like a fried chow mein noodle
it wasn't like spaetzle but it wasn't
unlike spaetzle and at the same time it
was kind of similar to a shoestring
potato
all right touched a little salt on there
and I dug in with a fork and then I was
even more confused so here's what I'm
asking what the heck are these what
should we call him what should we do
them should we do anything with him was
this a complete waste of time was this
interesting I don't know I'm at a loss
I'm at a total loss for words and even
at a loss for thoughts which is you know
kind of scary anyway go check out the
site for more information as well as the
ingredients I used in these mystery
noodles and as always enjoy
